title: Bihar government pledges one crore jobs in five years
content: Governor Arif Mohammad Khan highlights welfare schemes, women’s empowerment, and agricultural growth during joint address to State legislature

title: Raitanna Mee Kosam a direct bridge between farmers and government, says Minister
content: The programme will directly register farmers’ grievances, crop-related issues and field challenges, and ensure they reached the Chief Minister for immediate response

title: Those magnificent dubashes and their musicians
content: Rather like the industrial houses and corporates that support the arts now by way of CSR funds, and make the December Season possible, support then was by way of the dubashes – fabulously rich and with retinues of performing artistes

title: Raj Bhavan renamed ‘Lok Bhavan’ in Karnataka
content: The change is made in accordance with communication from the Union Ministry of Home Affairs and has been approved by the Governor of Karnataka.

title: Lok Sabha passes Bill to levy excise duty on tobacco
content: The Bill, once enacted, will give the government the fiscal space to increase the rate of central excise duty on tobacco and related products after GST compensation cess

title: Surge in abandonment of elderly patients alarms doctors at State-run Trauma Centre on Victoria Hospital campus
content: Nearly 60 such abandoned senior citizens have been shifted to shelters and old-age care facilities since January

title: ‘Rythanna Meekosam’ a publicity stunt, says YSRCP leader
content: This is nothing but a farmers’ deception campaign, with crores of public money wasted on propaganda, says Karumuri Venkata Nageswara Rao

title: Officials directed to expedite all irrigation projects in Sathya Sai district
content: Timely completion is crucial to improving groundwater levels and mitigating severe drought conditions, says Collector after reviewing various projects

title: Fake news a threat to democracy, needs urgent and firm action: I&B Minister
content: Social media was being used to create certain ecosystems that did not wish to follow the Constitution of India or comply with the laws enacted by Parliament, Ashwini Vaishnaw said

title: Jayalalithaa’s ₹13.69 crore tax arrears case: Madras High Court allows nephew Deepak to get impleaded
content: Justice C. Saravanan allows an impleading petition filed by J. Deepak after reading a news report in The Hindu regarding a writ petition filed by his sister J. Deepa against the recovery

title: Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda pulls up BMRCL over prolonged delays in Blue Line Metro work
content: Minister criticised officials for taking two years to erect a single Metro pillar a task that, he said, should ideally be completed within two months.

title: BJP alleges Congress shows contempt for Hindu beliefs and traditions
content: Party questions alleged remarks by Congress Chief Ministers and links them to a wider agenda against “Sanatana Dharma”

title: Panipat's "Killer Mom" Murders Young Son, Niece, 2 Others
content: A woman has been arrested for murdering her 6-year-old niece in Haryana's Panipat, police said on Wednesday. The reason: she did not want anyone to look "more beautiful" than her.

title: All Potholes In Delhi-NCR To Be Filled In 72 Hours To Curb Pollution: Minister
content: All potholes should be repaired in Delhi-National Capital Region (NCR) within 72 hours, Delhi's Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa announced today as the region finds innovative ways to fight air pollution.

title: "Ultimate Test": Teen Who Recited 2,000 Vedic Mantras Prepared For 12 Years
content: A teenager from Maharashtra has created history by memorising and reciting 2,000 sacred verses from the Shukla Yajurveda in a special Vedic style called Dandkarma Parayanam.

title: 200 IndiGo Flights Cancelled, Ops Hit, Airline Blames "Flight Duty" Audit
content: IndiGo, India's largest airline, is facing one of its most severe operational breakdowns in recent years, with flight delays and cancellations sweeping across the country.

title: Man Arrested For Laundering Rs 78 Crore In Rs 3,500-Crore Andhra Liquor Scam
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) investigating the massive Rs 3,500 crore Andhra Pradesh liquor scam has arrested Anil Chokhara, a bullion (gold/silver) trader from Mumbai.

title: 7 Maoists, 2 Cops Killed In Chhattisgarh Clash, 270 Extremists Dead In 2025
content: Seven Maoists and two personnel of the District Reserve Guard (DRG), a specialized unit of the state police, were killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Wednesday, officials said.

title: Trump Deserves Credit For Peace Deal In "Dangerous" India-Pak Clash: Marco Rubio
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio claimed that American President Donald Trump brokered several peace deals, such as the "very dangerous ones like India and Pakistan", and deserves "tremendous credit" for reshaping the foreign policy.

title: 'Broken Backbone, Soaked In Blood': Man, 25, Making Reels Plunges To Death
content: A 25-year-old man died after falling from a 50-foot bridge in the Raisen district of Madhya Pradesh while allegedly filming a reel with his mobile phone, a police official said on Wednesday.

title: Delhi Sees Over 2 Lakh Respiratory Cases In 6 Major Hospitals In 3 Years
content: The Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has disclosed that six major central government hospitals in Delhi recorded a staggering 2,04,758 cases of acute respiratory illness (ARI) presenting to emergency departments between 2022 and 2024.

title: Woman Gang Busted In Delhi, Items Worth Rs 1 Crore Recovered
content: Two active women-led criminal gangs, one operating across Gujarat and Delhi, and another based in the Anand Parbat area of Delhi, were busted by police on Wednesday.

title: Israel To Let Palestinians Leave Gaza Through Rafah Border
content: Israel on Wednesday said it will start letting Palestinians leave Gaza through a reopened border crossing, complying with a US-backed ceasefire deal.

title: Man Who Bid 1.17 Crores For HR88B8888 Number Plate Now Faces Assets Inquiry
content: Haryana Transport Minister Anil Vij has ordered investigation into the assets and income of Sudhir Kumar, Director of transportation service Romulus Solutions Private Limited, man who bid Rs 1.17 crore for 'HR88B8888' number plate.

title: Israel Is Turning Rifles Into Drone Interceptors. Soon To Be 'Made In India'
content: Israel Weapon Industries (IWI), one of the country's largest private defence companies, is using smart, computer-assisted rifles to fix human errors on the battlefield.

title: 'SIR Amit Shah's Ploy To Capture Bengal, Won't Succeed': Mamata Banerjee
content: The Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter lists in poll-bound West Bengal was Union Home Minister Amit Shah's "clever ploy" to topple the 14-year-old Trinamool Congress government, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee alleged today

title: Opinion: Opinion | India Still Needs Something Like Sanchar Saathi - Just Not Like This
content: India is experiencing what authorities describe as a "peak menace" of digital fraud. The Supreme Court recently took suo motu cognisance of digital arrest scams after victims collectively lost approximately Rs 3,000 crore.

title: "Personal Visit: DK Shivakumar Plays Down Delhi Trip Amid Power Tussle In State
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar is on way to Delhi today amid the huge row over the rotation of the top post in the state.

title: Amadeus: The Software Behind The 45-Minute Airport Check-In Glitch
content: A sudden 45-minute glitch in a major airline software system triggered airport-wide check-in delays on Tuesday. Air India later confirmed the system stabilised and flights ran as scheduled.

title: After Court Order, Tamil Nadu Temple May Light Lamp Amid Row Over Location
content: The traditional lighting of a temple lamp in Tamil Nadu's Thirupparankundram is rapidly turning into a political row that could cost the ruling DMK in the assembly election due early next year.

title: Rupee Crosses 90-Mark Against US Dollar: Impact On Markets, Students Abroad
content: The fall came amid weak trade and portfolio flows, persistent importer demand, and uncertainty surrounding the India-US trade deal.

title: Blinkit Launches Feature Allowing Users To Add Items After Placing Order
content: Quick-commerce platform Blinkit now allows customers to add items even after placing an order, CEO Albinder Dhindsa announced Wednesday.

title: NGT orders probe into public complaints against Ambayathode-based waste rendering unit
content: Suo motu case registered based on The Hindu report over the concerns raised by the affected families and the arguments of the company management

title: Excise duty to ensure tax incidence on tobacco remains same after GST cess ends: Sitharaman
content: “Since the GST law caps maximum rate of tax at 40%, the ultimate tax incidence on tobacco after removal of GST cess would come down from the current level if excise duty is not levied,” said the Finance Minister

title: Ilaiyaraaja and producers of Tamil movies Good Bad Ugly, Dude reach compromise after payment of ₹50 lakh
content: They file a joint memo stating that the civil suits filed by the musician could be decreed in terms of the compromise reached between them

title: SC turns spotlight on glitches in pay-outs, free critical care to acid attack victims
content: Bench seeks data from NALSA on compensation delays and private hospitals denying free critical care to acid attack victims

title: Hanuma jayanti procession organised by Hindu Jagran Vedike in Srirangapatna
content: As Mandya was rocked by communal clashes recently, the district administration and the police had taken adequate measures to prevent any untoward incident

title: Calcutta HC's Division Bench sets aside order terminating appointment of 32,000 primary teachers
content: Court underscores the importance of stability for teachers and their families, asserting that only a fraction of appointments faced irregularities amid broader scrutiny

title: Five Maoists, one jawan killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: The gun battle took place in a forest of the Gangaloor area adjoining Dantewada district when a joint team of security personnel was out on an anti-Maoist operation, a police official said

title: RPF sub-inspector rescues man who slipped while boarding moving train in Salem
content: Jayamani, who was travelling from Chennai to Kottayam, had alighted to buy a water bottle and attempted to board the train again as it began to move. He slipped and became trapped between the platform and the moving train

title: Bengaluru advocate files police complaint against Bollywood actor Ranveer Singh for ‘hurting religious sentiments’ of Tulu community
content: He submitted a written complaint alleging that the actor mocked the sacred daiva tradition during his stage act at the closing ceremony of the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) held in Goa on November 28

title: Court posts Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil’s bail plea in rape case for further hearing on December 4
content: Thiruvananthapuram Principal Sessions Court conducts hearing in camera. Investigators say prosecution sought more time to produce additional materials

title: Install emission monitors by December 31 or face closure, Centre warns Delhi-NCR industries
content: The Central Government also directed Delhi-NCR states to finalise their 2026 air pollution control plans within this month

title: M.P. cough syrup deaths: ED attaches assets of Coldrif promoter in Chennai
content: The Enforcement Directorate has attached two Chennai flats worth ₹2.04 crore belonging to G. Ranganathan, promoter of Sresan Pharmaceuticals

title: T.N. CM Stalin distributes wheelchairs to persons with disabilities
content: He also presented awards to organisations, teachers, and social activists working for the welfare of persons with disabilities, on the occasion of International Day of Persons with Disabilities

title: Government withdraws mandatory Sanchar Saathi pre-installation on phones after backlash
content: The Ministry of Communications attributed the policy reversal to the app’s ‘increasing acceptance’ among users

title: Former AIADMK MLA R. Chinnasamy joins DMK
content: R. Chinnasamy, who was elected from the Singanallur Assembly constituency, was the secretary of the Anna Thozhirsanga Peravai

title: Sunali Khatun was pushed to Bangladesh despite being Indian, says Mamata Banerjee
content: On Wednesday (December 3, 2025), the Union Government agreed to bring Ms. Khatun and her minor son back from Bangladesh on “humanitarian grounds” after the Supreme Court’s intervention on her deportation earlier this year

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Rains lash south coastal Andhra Pradesh
content: Tirupati, Nellore and Prakasam districts receive total rainfall of 2,137 mm, 1,415 mm and 11.4 mm by Wednesday morning 6 a.m. (December 3)

title: Sonia, Kharge protest in Parliament complex against new labour codes
content: Carrying posters and placards against the new labour codes, the Opposition MPs raised slogans demanding their rollback

title: Watch: Former BrahMos Chief calls for stronger India-Russia defence ties
content: Ex-BrahMos chief Sudhir Kumar Mishra said Russia remained India’s most trusted defence partner amid shifting global dynamics. He urged Indian defence firms to deepen partnerships with Russia, adding that it was the only country willing to share cutting-edge technologies that many other nations “won’t even show”.

title: Andhra Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan orders constitution of party committees up to Parliamentary constituency level
content: As far as the conflict management committee was concerned, Pawan Kalyan said either three members or the full committee should discuss issues referred to it depending on their seriousness

title: Court extends NIA custody of Delhi blast accused Jasir Wani by seven days
content: Jasir Bilal Wani was produced in court as his current seven-day custody, granted by the Principal Sessions and District Judge, Anju Bajaj Chandna, on November 27, was set to end on Wednesday (December 3, 2025)

title: UDF convener Adoor Prakash hints at likely action against MLA Rahul Mamkootathil after new sexual assault charges
content: Adoor Prakash says he held discussions with KPCC president Sunny Joseph after another complaint of alleged sexual assault against Palakkad MLA was e-mailed by a woman to KPCC president on Tuesday

title: Supreme Court gives bail to former Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi in money laundering case
content: A Bench of Justices Dipankar Datta and Augustine George Masih passed the order on an appeal filed by Mr. Joshi challenging the Rajasthan High Court’s August order denying him bail

title: Jharkhand Health Secretary asks officials to identify land for health sub-centres; submit report in 48 hours
content: “Several districts reported that land for the purpose has been identified, while the process was still pending in some districts,” an official release said

title: Delhi HC upholds admission test for Class VI in CM SHRI Schools, says no violation of RTE
content: The Court’s ruling reinforces the distinction between entry-level admissions and transfers, emphasising that the Right to Education Act permits screening for students seeking advancement to specialised institutions like CM SHRI Schools

title: Maharashtra municipal elections: Citizens’ manifesto seeks transparency, clean air, water, staffing overhaul
content: The manifesto calls for transparent governance, open civic data, and stronger municipal capacities to make Maharashtra’s cities resilient and citizen centric

title: Parasitic plant presumed extinct rediscovered in Kerala’s Wayanad district
content: Plant rediscovered from a forest region that lies less than 5 km from Chooralmala and Mundakkai, the sites of the deadly landslides of July 30, 2024, say researchers

title: William Dalrymple reveals Ellora’s hidden history: More than just caves | Pulse Maharastra
content:
Historian William Dalrymple, speaking at Ellora during UN@80 celebrations, uncovers the site’s hidden layers from ancient Naga worship to Jain, Buddhist, Hindu traditions and Sufi shrines. He calls Ellora a “continuum of faiths” and urges Maharashtra to unlock its global tourism potential. Watch the full conversation now for insights into one of South Asia’s greatest cultural treasures!

Presentation: Vinaya Deshpande Pandit 
Editing: Tayyab Hussain S M
Video: Mayur Bargaje and Gautam Nirmal Doshi

title: YouTuber Rahul Easwar remanded in police custody amid support for rape accused MLA Rahul Mamkootathil
content: Rahul Easwar had declared a hunger strike in prison and reiterated that he would continue to support Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil. Court orders prison authorities to ensure Rahul Easwar received medical attention

title: New Bihar Government committed to creation of 1 crore jobs in next 5 years: Governor
content: Bihar Governor Arif Mohammad Khan also made a mention of the Mukhya Mantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana, launched a month ahead of the announcement of assembly polls, which has been credited for tilting the scales in favour of the NDA

title: Doctor to be sentenced for selling Matthew Perry ketamine before ’Friends’ star’s overdose death
content: Prosecutors are asking U.S. District Judge Sherilyn Peace Garnett to sentence Dr. Plasencia, 44, to three years in prison after a plea agreement where the doctor admitted to illegally selling Perry large amounts of ketamine

title: BLO on SIR duty attempts to end life in Meerut; family alleges harassment by supervisor
content: Family members claimed Mohit Chaudhary had been under severe stress for several days due to dual responsibilities and a heavy workload

title: Muzaffarnagar police remove over 55 loudspeakers from mosques in drive against noise violations
content: According to police, the loudspeakers were taken down from mosques located in the Civil Lines, Kotwali and Khalapar police station areas as part of the enforcement campaign

title: Parliament Winter session: Rajya Sabha witnesses war of words over renaming of Raj Bhavans, expunging of remarks
content: The discussion took a contentious turn when AITC member Dola Sen raised additional issues, including MGNREGA, prompting the Chair to state that the deviated remarks would not go on record

title: BJP rakes up controversy over Telangana CM Revanth’s remarks comparing diversity in Hinduism with Congress’s political culture
content: CM Revanth Reddy urged the newly appointed DCC presidents to be accommodative and adjust to differing opinions within the party, irrespective of personal beliefs.

title: Spam calls: DoT to mandate display of KYC-registered names on incoming calls
content: The feature, known as Caller Name Presentation, will use the same technology that telecom operators use to flag certain calls as “Suspected” or “Suspicious”

title: Begin by fixing system, clean air will follow: Kiran Bedi pitches five reforms for pollution fight
content: The former IPS officer said that the CAQM is led by a retired official who, while experienced, lack the administrative leverage and political heft essential to move ministries and influence budgets

title: After Supreme Court intervention, Centre agrees to take back pregnant woman, child deported to Bangladesh
content: The Centre assured the Supreme Court that the woman would be provided free care and the necessary facilities, taking into consideration her medical condition

title: Modi-Trump ‘huglomacy’ in deep freeze, says Congress as Rubio repeats Trump’s claims of brokering India-Pakistan ceasefire
content: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said that Mr. Trump has brokered several peace deals, including the very dzangerous ones like India and Pakistan, and deserves tremendous credit for reshaping America’s foreign policy

title: Crew crunch hits IndiGo: Over 200 flights cancelled; chaos at major airports
content: IndiGo is experiencing significant flight delays and cancellations, impacting nearly two out of three domestic passengers. This disruption stems from a critical crew shortage following the implementation of new flight duty time limitations. The airline, known for its punctuality, has seen its on-time performance plummet, causing widespread inconvenience during the peak travel season.

title: Rupee plummets: Currency hits all-time low of 90.21 vs $; what's driving crash
content: The Indian Rupee hit a historic low on Wednesday, crossing the 90-per-dollar mark for the first time. This decline was driven by foreign fund outflows, rising crude oil prices, and uncertainty surrounding the India-US trade deal. Market watchers noted a lack of Reserve Bank of India intervention for much of the session.

title: 'Pre-installation not mandatory': Govt rolls back Sanchar Saathi order
content: The government has withdrawn its mandate for mobile manufacturers to pre-install the Sanchar Saathi app on new smartphones. This decision follows concerns about privacy and surveillance, with the government clarifying the app's purpose is solely for citizen cybersecurity. The app's growing user acceptance has led to the voluntary installation option.

title: 'Humanitarian grounds': SC allows deported pregnant woman to return from Bangladesh
content: The Supreme Court allowed a pregnant woman and her child to enter India on humanitarian grounds after their deportation to Bangladesh. The court directed the West Bengal government to provide care and medical support, including delivery, for the woman. This decision follows the Centre's challenge to a Calcutta High Court order that deemed the deportation illegal.

title: Sanchar Saathi: Govt explains why it withdrew mandate on pre-installing the app
content: The Ministry of Communications has reversed its decision to mandate the pre-installation of the Sanchar Saathi app on mobile devices. This move comes as the app has seen significant user adoption, with 1.4 crore downloads and a recent surge in registrations. The government emphasized the app's role in cybersecurity and denied it being a surveillance tool.

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill gets vice-captain role for T20Is — with one major BCCI condition
content: Shubman Gill has been named Suryakumar Yadav's deputy for the upcoming T20I series against South Africa, pending medical clearance. Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah also return to the 15-member squad. Rinku Singh has been omitted from the team that recently toured Australia. The series commences on December 9.

title: IND vs SA: BCCI announces India's 15-man squad for South Africa T20Is; Gill included with a twist
content: Suryakumar Yadav will captain India's T20I squad against South Africa, with Shubman Gill named vice-captain pending fitness. The team features a strong batting lineup including Abhishek Sharma and Hardik Pandya, alongside versatile all-rounders and a balanced bowling attack led by Jasprit Bumrah and spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakaravarthy.

title: Tech layoffs: IBM CEO says job cuts not due to AI; blames overhiring in Covid years
content: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna attributes current tech layoffs to pandemic-era over-hiring, not AI, calling it a "natural correction." While acknowledging AI will cause some job displacement, Krishna believes increased productivity will lead to new roles and overall hiring growth, particularly for college graduates.

title: New look, new colours: Team India's T20 World Cup 2026 jersey revealed
content: The jersey was unveiled by former India captain Rohit Sharma who is also the brand ambassador of the tournament, and member of the Indian T20 side Tilak Varma. The upcoming T20 World Cup will be co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka and is set to begin on February 7, with the final scheduled for March 8. Suryakumar Yadav and his team will kick off their campaign against the USA on February 7 in Mumbai.

title: No to Russian gas: EU aims to ban supply by 2027 - what's the plan?
content: The European Union has agreed to completely halt Russian gas imports by autumn 2027, ending new long-term pipeline contracts by September 30, 2027, and LNG deals by January 1, 2027. This move aims to enhance energy security and independence, with a roadmap also being drafted to eliminate Russian oil imports to Hungary and Slovakia by the same deadline.

title: Delhi MCD bypolls: BJP sweeps major seats, AAP secures narrow wins; check full list of winners
content: The BJP secured a dominant victory in the Delhi Municipal Corporation bypolls, winning seven out of twelve wards. The AAP managed to win three seats, while the Congress and AIFB secured one each. This outcome is seen as a significant electoral test for the BJP following their recent rise to power in Delhi.

title: 'US falling behind': Ford CEO on worker shortage; company struggling to fill mechanic roles
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley warns of a critical US trade worker shortage, leaving 1 million jobs unfilled. He highlights a dangerous gap compared to China in building essential workforces, impacting national security. Farley advocates for rebuilding the blue-collar pipeline through investment in trade schools and education, emphasizing fair wages and career paths for workers.

title: 'Clocking speed of 140 kmph': Influencer dies in horrific crash; named his bike 'Laila'
content: An 18-year-old died after losing control of his KTM sports bike near Surat's Breadliner Circle. Speeding and reportedly not wearing a helmet, Prince Patel crashed into the road divider, sustaining fatal head injuries. He was known for posting high-speed bike videos on social media.

title: Anushka's adorable reaction to Virat Kohli's 53rd ODI century goes viral — See post
content: Virat Kohli smashed his 53rd ODI century, a remarkable 102, in India's second match against South Africa. This century, his second consecutive of the series, propelled his international tally to 84 hundreds. He also set a new record for consecutive ODI centuries, surpassing AB de Villiers.

title: RPSC ASO 2025 answer key released; objection window now open
content: The Rajasthan Public Service Commission has released the provisional answer key for the Assistant Statistical Officer exam. Candidates can now check their tentative scores and raise objections against any discrepancies. The window for submitting challenges, along with supporting documents and a fee, opens on December 4, 2025, and closes on December 6, 2025.

title: Delhi’s pollution surge puts heart and diabetes patients at risk
content: In a dire report from Delhi, healthcare facilities have logged more than 200,000 cases of acute respiratory issues, predominantly threatening at-risk groups such as those with diabetes and heart ailments. The toxic smog is not just a nuisance; it intensifies pre-existing health conditions, causing rapid arterial narrowing and extra stress on the heart.

title: Carter Hart returns after case, leads Golden Knights to 4-3 win vs Blackhawks
content: Carter Hart returned to NHL action after nearly two years, making 30 saves and delivering crucial stops in a 4-3 shootout win for the Vegas Golden Knights. Despite early rust and allowing three goals, Hart found his form late, securing his first NHL victory since January 2024 and signaling a hopeful step forward in his comeback.

title: Nasa’s Bennu asteroid holds secrets of life hidden for billions of years
content: Bennu asteroid samples returned by NASA's OSIRIS-REx mission reveal life's building blocks, including sugars like ribose and glucose. Scientists also found a unique nitrogen-rich polymer, offering clues to early life's chemical origins. The asteroid's high concentration of supernova dust sheds light on its formation environment and the distribution of presolar materials in our early solar system.

title: ‘Kitne paise chahiye tereko?’: Sunny Deol loses his cool at sneaky pap- video
content: Sunny Deol blasts sneaky paparazzo—"Paisa chahiye? Kitne paise chahiye tere ko?"—during Dharmendra's Haridwar asthi visarjan video. The icon died Nov 24 post-hospital stay; family immersed ashes Dec 3 privately. Sunny, Bobby led rites; he has 6 kids from wives Prakash Kaur, Hema Malini.

title: Putin’s visit under Trump tariff shadow: What’s at stake for India and Russia?
content: Russian President Putin's India visit is crucial for trade dynamics amidst US pressure. India's energy security is now heavily reliant on discounted Russian crude, reshaping its procurement patterns. The visit aims to manage dependence in a fractured world, focusing on securing fuel, weapons, and payments.

title: 'Give Royal Enfield or Rs 2 lakh': UP bride thrown out day after marriage over dowry
content: A Kanpur bride was shockingly sent back to her parental home just a day after her wedding due to dowry demands. Her in-laws allegedly demanded a Royal Enfield motorcycle or Rs 2 lakh, forcibly took her gifts, and physically assaulted her. Police have registered a case against the groom and his family.

title: Silver futures cross Rs 1.85 lakh per kg mark as rupee dips
content: Silver price today: Silver prices surged to a new high of Rs 1,84,727 per kilogram on Wednesday, driven by a weakening rupee and strong international market trends. Gold futures also climbed significantly, with both precious metals benefiting from expectations of a US Federal Reserve interest rate cut next week.

title: IND vs SA: Why Harshit Rana was reprimanded by ICC; India pacer accepts the charge
content: Indian pacer Harshit Rana has been reprimanded by the ICC for a provocative send-off of Dewald Brevis during India's ODI win over South Africa. Rana received one demerit point for violating the Code of Conduct, accepting the sanction without a hearing. India aims to seal the series in Raipur.

title: Mike Tyson reveals $40k monthly cannabis habit, says family urged him to restart
content: Mike Tyson revealed on a podcast that his family urged him to resume smoking cannabis after a brief five-day break, as his intense, unmedicated demeanor frightened them.  He explained that marijuana helps him manage his mood, maintain calm, and feel more like himself, contrasting it with the negative effects of alcohol.

title: Rs 90 to a dollar: What it means for your EMI, education, and everyday life
content: The Indian rupee has fallen below Rs 90 to the US dollar for the first time, signaling a shift in economic perception and impacting households. This depreciation, driven by trade tensions, investor exodus, and an RBI policy shift, makes imports costlier and affects education and travel expenses for citizens.

title: ‘Not losing sleep’: CEA Nageswaran on rupee touching 90 mark versus US dolla
content: India's rupee hit a historic low of 90.30 against the US dollar, yet the government remains unconcerned. Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran stated the depreciation hasn't impacted inflation or exports, expressing optimism for a recovery next year. Factors like FII outflows and dollar demand are influencing the currency's slide.

title: 'Women's hockey at breaking point': Former stars demand urgent fix
content: Senior women's hockey coach Harendra Singh resigned citing personal reasons, but sources point to long-standing player grievances. Eight senior players submitted an 18-point letter detailing allegations of mental harassment, prompting an investigation by Hockey India. The team's future hangs in the balance amidst calls for honesty and bold decisions.

title: 'How many Gods are there in Hinduism, 3 crore?': Revanth Reddy's comments trigger row
content: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy's remarks comparing Congress's diversity to Hinduism's varied deities have sparked outrage from BJP leaders. Party workers protested, burning his effigy, while Union ministers accused him of anti-Hindu sentiments and called for Hindu unity. BJP insists its warnings about Hindu self-respect have been proven true.

title: ‘Your country stinks’: Trump says Somalis 'come from hell and do nothing but complain'
content: President Trump labelled Somali immigrants as "garbage," claiming they drain social services and contribute nothing. He called for their deportation, citing fraud allegations and linking them to terrorism.  This comes as intensified deportation efforts target Somali residents in Minnesota, home to the largest diaspora.  Rep. Ilhan Omar, a Somali-American, responded to the President's remarks.

title: Experts warn how overconsumption of chai in winter can cause stiffening in joints
content: Winter mornings often feature warm chai and coffee. However, health experts warn this habit can harm joint health. Excessive tea and coffee intake can lead to dehydration, stiffening joints, especially knees. This is because cold weather reduces water intake while increasing hot beverage consumption. Synovial fluid, crucial for joint lubrication, thickens when the body is dehydrated.

title: How spiritual are you? Take this 5 minute test to know about your hidden spiritual side
content: How spiritual are you? Being spiritual helps people look at life with a stoic understanding and navigate it with a maturity which makes things easier. Take the following test to know how much awakened are you and how it can be helpful for you.

title: ‘Inhuman agenda’: Sabrina Carpenter slams White House for using her song in 'disgusting' video
content: Pop star Sabrina Carpenter publicly condemned the White House after her song 'Juno' was used in a video promoting deportations without her permission. The White House responded by defending its actions. This follows similar objections from musicians like Kenny Loggins and Olivia Rodrigo regarding their music's use in political messaging.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 18K gold costs in Mumbai, Delhi & other cities
content: Gold prices are soaring domestically and internationally, driven by a weakening rupee and anticipation of US monetary easing.  Local rates jumped significantly as the rupee hit an all-time low.  Globally, gold and silver futures firmed up, with investors betting on a US Federal Reserve interest rate cut next week, boosting confidence in the precious metal.

title: Shubman Gill all set to play T20Is vs South Africa
content: Shubman Gill is currently undergoing rehabilitation at the BCCI CoE but is likely to link-up with the T20I squad in Cuttack. He has started batting without discomfort and is likely to take part in a match simulation before getting clearance from the BCCI medical team.

title: Travis Kelce reportedly feels claustrophobic amid pressure before Taylor Swift wedding
content: Travis Kelce faces immense pressure planning his wedding with Taylor Swift.  The world watches their every move.  He juggles football, his podcast, businesses, and acting dreams.  Sources say he feels claustrophobic and overwhelmed.  Taylor Swift's security team is also on edge due to constant public attention.  Despite the stress, the couple remains focused on their season and wedding plans.

title: Another technical snag: Microsoft outage delays check-in at airports; flights affected
content: Flight operations faced significant disruptions Wednesday morning as check-in systems at multiple airports simultaneously failed. Airlines, including IndiGo and Air India Express, resorted to manual procedures, leading to flight delays. Passengers were informed of a global Microsoft Windows service outage impacting airport IT systems.

title: Nifty to cross 29,000 levels! Check top picks for your portfolio by Nomura
content: Nomura forecasts a potential 13% upside for the Nifty in 2026, projecting it to reach 29,300. This optimism stems from improving domestic and global conditions, including calmer geopolitics and stable macros. The brokerage also identified its top stock picks, anticipating a cyclical recovery in economic and corporate earnings growth.

title: Dog remark row: Cong MP’s ‘bhow bhow’ reply to question on privilege motion — watch
content: Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury responded to a potential privilege motion for bringing a dog to Parliament with a bark, questioning the outrage over the animal while other pressing issues are ignored. She asserted there's no rule against bringing pets and vowed to continue caring for animals, suggesting the "real dogs" are in Parliament.

title: IND vs SA: 20 tosses, zero luck! India's baffling streak continues
content: India's unusual streak of losing 20 consecutive ODI tosses continued as South Africa's captain won the flip and chose to bowl. Despite this, KL Rahul's team, already leading the series, expressed confidence in their ability to perform. The pitch presented a mixed bag, with potential for uneven bounce and reverse swing, making chasing a preferred option.

title: ‘Lacks moral character’:Indian national jailed in US over medicare fraud of $1.17M
content: An Indian national, Mohammed Asif, has been sentenced to two years in US federal prison for orchestrating a Medicare fraud scheme. His Everett-based lab, American Labworks LLC, billed over $8 million for unreceived Covid-19 and respiratory tests, defrauding Medicare of more than $1.1 million. Asif, who controlled the lab's finances, will also pay over $1.1 million in restitution.

title: Freefalling Clippers abruptly sever ties with Paul
content: Chris Paul, one of the greatest players in Clippers franchise history, posted an Instagram story a little before 3 a.m. ET Wednesday that he had just learned he was being sent home to Los Angeles from Atlanta.

title: Ole Miss rises to sixth in latest CFP rankings
content: Despite former coach Lane Kiffin's departure to LSU over the weekend, 11-1 Ole Miss was not penalized by the College Football Playoff selection committee, as the Rebels actually moved up to No. 6 following their 38-19 win at Mississippi State.

title: Sources: No. 1 recruit to hold off on LSU signing
content: LSU pledge Lamar Brown, ESPN's No. 1 overall prospect in the 2026 class, is waiting for Lane Kiffin to assemble his staff before signing with the Tigers.

title: Evans' 3 sends Blue Devils over champion Gators
content: A go-ahead 3-pointer with 19.7 seconds left by Duke sophomore Isaiah Evans sent the No. 4 Blue Devils to a 67-66 win over reigning national champion Florida on Tuesday, an effort that gave them a 9-0 mark, including five wins at Cameron Indoor Stadium.

title: LSU's Kiffin to let Weis Jr. coach Ole Miss in CFP
content: LSU assistant Charlie Weis Jr., who is part of new coach Lane Kiffin's staff with the Tigers, will be allowed to return to Ole Miss and serve as offensive coordinator through the College Football Playoff.

title: Vanderbilt flips five-star QB Curtis from Georgia
content: Five-star quarterback Jared Curtis, ESPN's No. 1 pocket passer and the No. 5 overall recruit in the 2026 class, flipped his commitment from Georgia to Vanderbilt on Tuesday, sources told ESPN.

title: Fitzgerald: 'There will be no more motivated coach'
content: Pat Fitzgerald spoke with eight schools about potential coaching jobs, looking for the best place to resume his career, before choosing Michigan State. "It was almost a no-brainer for me when the opportunity was presented," he said Tuesday.

title: Back in NHL, Hart debuts for Vegas after acquittal
content: Goalie Carter Hart, one of five 2018 Canada world junior hockey players acquitted of sexual assault in July, made his first NHL appearance in nearly two years Tuesday night, debuting for the Golden Knights in a 4-3 shootout victory over the Blackhawks.

title: NFL Week 14 buzz: What we're hearing on Bryce Young, Shedeur Sanders and tight division races
content: Will Carolina extend Bryce Young? Could Cleveland stick with Shedeur Sanders in 2026? Here's the latest intel.

title: The best at everything: Picking the top players at 109 different skills
content: Most accurate passer? Dak Prescott. Most explosive edge rusher? Myles Garrett. And much more to examine.

title: Lineup production? Pitching? Just ... more? Biggest needs for 10 contenders
content: Here's what some of the best teams will be targeting this offseason -- and which players fit those needs.

title: How CFB's 'calendar' problem affects athletes more than coaches such as Lane Kiffin
content: Unlike coaches, high school kids don't have multimillion-dollar buyouts to fall back on, Dan Wetzel writes.

title: A final farewell to Lane Kiffin and the rest of the Bottom 10
content: With the season over and the final votes tallied, we crown the best of the worst -- on and off the field.

title: UNC volleyball's Jackie Taylor honors late father, NFL legend Sean Taylor
content: Jackie Taylor wears No. 21 for North Carolina. When she leaps for a ball and slams it to the ground, NFL fans remember a man she never met.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: Many star volleyball players are wearing a hair-tie solution invented by three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: All-Star predictions: Which stars will we see in USA vs. the World?
content: the first selection process for the new USA vs. the world format this season will work almost the same as it has in the past . if the class of 24 All-Stars doesn't split perfectly into 16 american and eight international players . commissioner Adam Silver will add extra players to the roster to meet those minimums .

title: Charlie Kirk takes the No. 1 spot on Wikipedia’s most-read pages — check top 10

title: Men's ACC/SEC Challenge guide: What UNC, Duke, Syracuse wins tell us

title: College football national signing day live: Top commits, flips, moments
content: College football's national signing day kicked off Wednesday with the  early signing period .  Class of 2026  high school recruits who signed have locked into the college of their choice for at least the next year. The drama started early when Vanderbilt  flipped  five-star QB  Jared Curtis  from Georgia on Tuesday night. There are only eight ESPN 300 prospects who remain uncommitted, notably defensive end  Jordan Carter  (No. 57), the top uncommitted player, and QB  Peyton Falzone  (No. 225) who is the lone ranked, uncommitted quarterback. He decommitted from  Auburn  on Monday. If a prospect doesn't sign a national letter of intent by Friday, the next national signing day for this cycle begins Feb. 4. We are tracking the news, analysis and more throughout Wednesday. More:   Live class rankings updates  |  How the five-stars fit

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: How Kiffin, other new coaches are faring
content: the early signing period will bring some closure to the 2026 class with a large majority of recruits signing over the next few days . Lane Kiffin inherits a strong class built on in-state talent and led by the no. 1 overall prospect, DL Lamar Brown .
